message.content: To answer this question, we need to understand the concept of adaptation in animal species. As the leaves fall off the trees and food becomes less plentiful, animals in the environment may go through changes to adapt to these conditions. Hares growing longer fur is a likely occurrence because the longer fur will provide better insulation to keep them warm in the colder weather. Option (B) is incorrect because worms do not have fur, so they cannot grow longer fur. Option (C) is unrelated because worms do not sing. Option (D) is also unrelated because hares do not sing.

When leaves fall off the trees and food becomes less plentiful, animals that rely on camouflage for survival may grow longer fur to blend in with their surroundings. Option (C) is unrelated to the scenario and does not make sense in the context of animal adaptations.
